oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A homotopy theory of additive categories with suspensions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Li, Zhi-Wei
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Representation Theory
Mathematics - Category Theory
18E10, 18E30, 18E35
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We define partial one-sided triangulated categories by weakening the axioms of one-sided triangulated categories. We show that additive categories, exact categories, one-sided triangulated categories, complete cotorsion pairs in exact categories, torsion pairs and mutation pairs in triangulated categories extend to partial one-sided triangulated categories. We prove that partial one-sided triangulated categories yield one-sided triangulated categories by passing to stable categories. This unifies and generalizes many constructions of stable one-sided triangulated categories, and even stable exact categories. Moreover, it also allows us to model Iyama-Yoshino subfactor triangulated categories via Quillen closed model structures.
